DataElement.preferredName: Prior Strong Protein Kinase Inhibitor Cytochrome Inducer Administered Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine whether or not a strong protein kinase inhibitor and/or a cytochrome inducer were given at an earlier time.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Strong Protein Kinase Inhibitor Cytochrome Inducer Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected._Any substance that inhibits protein kinase, an enzyme that catalyzes the addition of a phosphate group to a protein and is active in many diverse signaling pathways._Hemeproteins whose characteristic mode of action involves transfer of reducing equivalents associated with a reversible change in oxidation state of the prosthetic group. Formally, this redox change involves a single-electron, reversible equilibrium between the Fe(II) and Fe(III) states of the central iron atom. (From Enzyme Nomenclature, 1992, p539)_A chemical or physical agent that turns on gene expression._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected.:Any substance that inhibits protein kinase, an enzyme that catalyzes the addition of a phosphate group to a protein and is active in many diverse signaling pathways.

Concepts.definition: Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected.
Any substance that inhibits protein kinase, an enzyme that catalyzes the addition of a phosphate group to a protein and is active in many diverse signaling pathways.

Property.preferredDefinition: Hemeproteins whose characteristic mode of action involves transfer of reducing equivalents associated with a reversible change in oxidation state of the prosthetic group. Formally, this redox change involves a single-electron, reversible equilibrium between the Fe(II) and Fe(III) states of the central iron atom. (From Enzyme Nomenclature, 1992, p539):A chemical or physical agent that turns on gene expression.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A family of membrane-associated, heme-containing proteins that catalyze oxidation and reduction to promote electron transport reactions.
A chemical or physical agent that turns on gene expression.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient receive treat
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient receive treatment with strong inhibitors and/or inducers of cytochrome P450 CYP3A4 or CYP2C19?
